DOC.brief_summary: Chronic non-specific low back pain (CNSLBP) has been defined as a persistent pain in the lower back for at least three months with no known causes. The CNSLBP prevalence is estimated of 90% among all types of the LBP. The LBP imposes high direct and indirect costs on the patients and the society. Whereas a specific pathology has not been identified for CNSLBP, mechanical factors (e.g. changes in muscle length, strength, or endurance) may contribute to the pain and disability.
DOC.brief_title: Predictors of Chronic Non-specific Low Back Pain
DOC.criteria: Patients with chronic nonspecific LBP, LBP duration â‰¥ 6 months. spinal osteoarthritis, spondylolisthesis, history of vertebral fractures.
